policies.involuntary_refund:
- Involuntary Refunds - If flight is canceled or rescheduled by 3 hours or more:
- Full refund applies for unused tickets. Refund must be processed within 72 hours after booking is affected.
- No waiver code required.
- For partially used tickets, refund applies to the unused segment. Refund must be processed within 72 hours after booking is affected.
policies.involuntary_reissue:
Involuntary reissue requests must follow the procedure below:
- Email the full PNR history showing the major schedule change of 3 hours or more
- Email the full PNR history showing the misconnection
- Include the desired itinerary and RBD availability
- Submit request to: usa@apg-ga.us for approval
policies.voluntary_refund:
- Refer to the fare rules associated with the ticket
- The non-refundable rule also applies to taxes.
policies.medical_refund: Proceed as per fare rules associated with the ticket
policies.name_change:
Name change is not allowed.
Name correction: Send the request to usa@apg-ga.us and attach passport for verification
policies.group_booking:
A group is considered when 10 passengers or more are traveling together.
Send your preferred itinerary to: usa@apg-ga.us
policies.infant_policy:
Infants under 14 days, premature or medically unfit infants not accepted.
- 1 adult = 1 infant
policies.baggage_policy: Refer to the terms and conditions of the fare purchased
policies.seat_request_policy: Seats can be assigned on the airline website
policies.short_term_cancellation_policy:
For flights to or from the United States, Cambodia Angkor Air complies with the U.S. Department of Transportation 24-hour rule:
- A full refund is available if the ticket is canceled within 24 hours of booking, provided the flight is at least 7 days away at the time of booking.
- After this 24-hour window, cancellation policies and any applicable fees will depend on the specific fare rules of the ticket.
